DOC.brief_summary: The investigators hope to see if a commonly used drug such as ketamine could help depressed ER patients feel better and improve their mood quickly.
DOC.brief_title: Ketamine for Low Mood States in the ER
DOC.detailed_description: Rapid-onset antidepressants could have important clinical impact if their benefits extended to Emergency Department (ED) patients. We hope to explore the preliminary feasibility, tolerability and efficacy of single-dose, intravenous (IV) ketamine in depressed ED patients who presented with suicide ideation (SI).
DOC.criteria: adults (>18yrs) presenting to the Emergency department with symptoms of depression and/or suicide ideation (MADRS>30) with ability to give informed consent. medically stable psychosis, bipolar, or other significant physical or mental illness pregnancy nonvoluntary status urine drug screen positive for drugs of abuse
